description: Unknown. Perhaps from daisy (the flower) or the name of Italian actress Eleonora Duse. The automobile manufacturer Duesenberg is often erroneously cited as the origin, but the word existed more than a decade earlier. Alternatively possibly from Polish du≈ºy, Introduced into America with the wave of Polish immigration around 1900.

adjectives.description: doozy (not generally comparable, comparative doozier, superlative dooziest)

entries.meaning: (slang, dated) Of high quality; remarkable; excellent. [1903]
(US, informal) Something that is extraordinary: often troublesome, difficult or problematic, but sometimes extraordinary in a positive sense.
